newsitem.title: GERMANY: Krauss-Maffei chief, Mannesmann part company.
newsitem.headline: Krauss-Maffei chief, Mannesmann part company.

text.p: The long-time chairman of Krauss-Maffei AG, Burkhard Wollschlaeger, said on Tuesday he would step down at the end of the year and leave the company.

Wollschlaeger, who has been at the helm of the plastics and defense firm for the past ten years, said in a statement he wanted to attend to other matters when Krauss-Maffei is fully consolidated into the Mannesmann group.

Mannesmann declined to comment further on the move, saying only that a successor for Wollschlaeger had not been appointed yet and the executive's decision was made in mutual agreement with Mannesmann.
Krauss-Maffei's supervisory board would decide on a successor at its next meeting in at the end of November.
Wollschlaeger will have no further ties to the company after he steps down, the Mannesmann spokesman said.
One company source said Wollschlaeger decided to leave the firm because of differences with Mannesmann executives over the future direction of Krauss-Maffei.
Mannesmann acquired outstanding shares in Krauss-Maffei earlier this year and consolidated the company after raising its stake to nearly 97 percent last year.
